publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5077 Marilyn Livingstone: Maggie’s Fife—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of Scotland’s newest Maggie’s Centre in Kirkcaldy on 3 November 2006; notes that Maggie’s Fife is the fifth centre to open and that this marks the 10th anniversary of the opening of the first centre in Edinburgh on 7 November 1996; recognises that Maggie’s Centres provide free-of-charge practical information, emotional and psychological support for anybody affected by cancer; acknowledges that the centre was designed by Zahia Hadid, the first and only woman to win the much-coveted Pritzker Prize, and congratulates the people of Kirkcaldy constituency and the wider Fife community for their tremendous generosity and amazing sustained support for the Fife Free Press-led fundraising campaign which promoted large numbers of local fundraising events. Supported by: Helen Eadie*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Tricia Marwick*, Murdo Fraser*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Mike Pringle*, Sarah Boyack*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Christine May*, Colin Fox*, Mr Frank McAveety*

S2M-5077 Maggie’s Fife (lodged on 1 November 2006) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Nora Radcliffe*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Jackie Baillie*, Bill Butler*, Karen Gillon*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, David McLetchie*, Alex Neil*, Bruce Crawford*, John Swinburne*, Trish Godman*, Cathie Craigie*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Robin Harper*

S2M-5077 Marilyn Livingstone: Maggie’s Fife—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of Scotland’s newest Maggie’s Centre in Kirkcaldy on 3 November 2006; notes that Maggie’s Fife is the fifth centre to open and that this marks the 10th anniversary of the opening of the first centre in Edinburgh on 7 November 1996; recognises that Maggie’s Centres provide free-of-charge practical information, emotional and psychological support for anybody affected by cancer; acknowledges that the centre was designed by Zahia Hadid, the first and only woman to win the much-coveted Pritzker Prize, and congratulates the people of Kirkcaldy constituency and the wider Fife community for their tremendous generosity and amazing sustained support for the Fife Free Press-led fundraising campaign which promoted large numbers of local fundraising events. Supported by: Helen Eadie, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Tricia Marwick, Murdo Fraser, Mr Mark Ruskell, Mike Pringle, Sarah Boyack, Roseanna Cunningham, Christine May, Colin Fox, Mr Frank McAveety, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Nora Radcliffe, Dr Elaine Murray, Jackie Baillie, Bill Butler, Karen Gillon, Mrs Mary Mulligan, David McLetchie, Alex Neil, Bruce Crawford, John Swinburne, Trish Godman, Cathie Craigie, Mr Brian Monteith, Ms Wendy Alexander, Robin Harper
S2M-5077 Maggie’s Fife (lodged on 1 November 2006) Dave Petrie*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-5077 Maggie’s Fife (lodged on 1 November 2006) Scott Barrie*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-5077 Maggie’s Fife (lodged on 1 November 2006) Ms Sandra White*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-5077 Maggie’s Fife (lodged on 1 November 2006) Susan Deacon*
S2M-5077 Maggie’s Fife (lodged on 1 November 2006) Eleanor Scott*
S2M-5077 Maggie’s Fife (lodged on 1 November 2006) Maureen Macmillan*, Cathy Peattie*
